Package cscd210utils

Class ArrayUtils

java.lang.Object
cscd210utils.ArrayUtils
public class ArrayUtils extends Object
The ArrayUtils class performs basic array functions, such as adding an item to the array removing items from the array, printing the arrays.
All parameters will be passed as final.
All pre and post conditions will be enforced

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static int[]
    addNum(int[] myArray, Scanner kb)
    The addNum method makes a new array that is one more in length the old array which is passed in.
    static int[]
    createAndFillArray(int num, Scanner kb)
    The createAndFillArray method creates the integer array of size num and then fills the array by asking the user to enter an integer.
    static int[]
    deleteSingleValue(int[] myArray, Scanner kb)
    The deleteSingleValue method first prompts the user to enter a value that should be deleted.
    Next the method searches through the array to determine if that value was in the array.
    If the value is not in the array, a message "Value NOT found" is displayed and the old array is returned.
    If the value is found a new array is made with the length being one less than the old array being passed in.
    Next the values are copied over except the value that will be deleted.
    Finally the new array is returned
    static void
    printArray(int[] myArray)
    The printArray method prints the array in the following fashion
    [value, value, value, ..., value]
    You must write this code without calling any methods in the API from any class

      public ArrayUtils()

  • Method Details

    • createAndFillArray

      public static int[] createAndFillArray(int num, Scanner kb)
      The createAndFillArray method creates the integer array of size num and then fills the array by asking the user to enter an integer.
      Parameters:
      num - Representing the size of the array to create
      kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
      Returns:
      int[] Representing created array that if filled with integers
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if num is less than or equal to 0
      IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

    • addNum

      public static int[] addNum(int[] myArray, Scanner kb)
      The addNum method makes a new array that is one more in length the old array which is passed in. The method then copies the values from the old array (index by index) and places the values in the new array. Finally the user is prompted to enter a value and that value is placed within the new array in the last index.
      Parameters:
      myArray - Representing the old array of integers that will be copied.
      kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
      Returns:
      int[] Representing the new array with a value added
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if myArray is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of myArray is less than zero

    • deleteSingleValue

      public static int[] deleteSingleValue(int[] myArray, Scanner kb)
      The deleteSingleValue method first prompts the user to enter a value that should be deleted.
      Next the method searches through the array to determine if that value was in the array.
      If the value is not in the array, a message "Value NOT found" is displayed and the old array is returned.
      If the value is found a new array is made with the length being one less than the old array being passed in.
      Next the values are copied over except the value that will be deleted.
      Finally the new array is returned
      Parameters:
      myArray - Representing the old array of integers
      kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
      Returns:
      int[] Representing the new/old array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if myArray is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of myArray is less than zero

    • printArray

      public static void printArray(int[] myArray)
      The printArray method prints the array in the following fashion
      [value, value, value, ..., value]
      You must write this code without calling any methods in the API from any class
      Parameters:
      myArray - Representing the array of integers to be printed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if myArray is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of myArray is less than zero
